Chili Mac

A hearty one-pot meal combining ground beef, beans, tomatoes, and pasta in a flavorful sauce, topped with melted cheese.

Yield: about 6 servings

beef
meal prep
pasta

Ingredients

Ingredients

  • 1.5 lb ground beef (prefer leaner)
  • 1 15oz can black beans
  • 1 15oz can diced tomatoes
  • 1 15oz can tomato sauce
  • 1 tbsp tomato paste
  • 4 cloves garlic, minced
  • 1/2 diced onion
  • 200g protein+ pasta
  • 120g cheese (colby jack or similar)

For Serving

  • sour cream
  • diced green onion
  • additional cheese
  • corn chips

Procedure

Cooking the Meat

  1. Cook the ground beef until mostly cooked through, breaking up as you go
  2. Set aside in a bowl lined with a paper towel to drain excess fat

Building the Sauce

  1. Add onions to the pan (adding any fat if needed) and cook until softened
  2. Add tomato paste and garlic, cooking until the tomato paste caramelizes a bit and the garlic is fragrant
  3. Add the diced tomatoes and tomato sauce to pan before the garlic burns
  4. Scrape up any bits on the bottom of the pan
  5. Return the meat to the sauce and combine

Cooking the Pasta

  1. Bring water to a boil and cook the pasta for half the time denoted on the package
  2. When the pasta is half cooked, reserve a cup of pasta water and then drain the par-cooked pasta

Final Assembly

  1. Add the beans and the pasta to the sauce to heat the beans and finish cooking the noodles
  2. If the sauce is too thick, use reserved pasta water to thin (it will thicken as the noodles cook and absorb water, so keep an eye on it)
  3. Once the noodles are cooked through, mix in the cheese
  4. Once the cheese has melted, serve
  5. Top with optional toppings as desired
